name: blatancy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very obvious and intentional, when this is a bad thing: Almost the worst aspect of the crime was its blatancy. The blatancy of the challenge to his authority made him very uncomfortable. Related word
blatant
More examplesFewer examples"It's the blatancy of it that enrages me," one resident complained. "They break into cars in broad daylight, in full view of everyone." The blatancy of what he had done almost seems to suggest he did not see anything wrong with it.Even the most cynical person would be shocked by the blatancy with which they have lied and tried to rewrite history.
